Value.label: Countdown timer
Value.Help: Number of minutes before it shutdown automatically (0 = disabled).

Value.label: Power state
Value.Help: Define how the plug will react after the power supply is back on.

Value.label: LED indicator
Value.Help: Set the intensity of the LED indicator (0-100).

Value.label: Saving state before power failure
Value.Help: Saving state before power failure

Item.label: State NOT saved at power failure, all outputs are set to OFF upon power restore
State saved at power failure, all outputs are set to previous state upon power restore

Value.label: First channel - operating mode
Value.Help: This parameter allows to choose operating for the 1st channel controlled by the S1 switch.

Value.label: First channel - reaction to switch for delay/auto ON/OFF modes
Value.Help: This parameter determines how the device in timed mode reacts to pushing the switch connected to the S1 terminal.

Item.label: Cancel mode and set target state
No reaction to switch - mode runs until it ends
Reset timer - start counting from the beginning

Value.label: First channel - time parameter for delay/auto ON/OFF modes
Value.Help: This parameter allows to set time parameter used in timed modes. (s)

Value.label: First channel - pulse time for flashing mode
Value.Help: This parameter allows to set time of switching to opposite state in flashing mode. 1-32000 (0.1-3200.0s, 0.1s step)

Value.label: Second channel - operating mode
Value.Help: This parameter allows to choose operating for the 2st channel controlled by the S2 switch.

Value.label: Second channel - reaction to switch for delay/auto ON/OFF modes
Value.Help: This parameter determines how the device in timed mode reacts to pushing the switch connected to the S2 terminal.

Item.label: Cancel mode and set target state
No reaction to switch - mode runs until it ends
Reset timer - start counting from the beginning

Value.label: Second channel - time parameter for delay/auto ON/OFF modes
Value.Help: This parameter allows to set time parameter used in timed modes. (s)

Value.label: Second channel - pulse time for flashing mode
Value.Help: This parameter allows to set time of switching to opposite state in flashing mode. 1-32000 (0.1-3200.0s, 0.1s step)

Value.label: Switch type
Value.Help: Inputs type configuration

Item.label: Toggle switch (contact closed - On, contact opened - OFF)
Toggle switch (device changes status when switch changes status)

Value.label: Flashing mode report
Value.Help: Enabled / Disabled reports on Flashing mode

Value.label: Associations in Z-Wave network security mode
Value.Help: This parameter defines how commands are sent to specified association groups: as secure or non-secure. Parameter is active only in Z-Wave network security mode. This parameter does not apply to 1st lifeline group. 1 - 2nd group sent as secure. 2 - 3rd group sent as secure. 4 - 4th group sent as secure. 8 - 5th group sent as secure. Default setting: 15 (all)

Value.label: S1 switch - scenes sent
Value.Help: This parameter determines which actions result in sending scene IDs assigned to them. 1 - Key pressed 1 time. 2 - Key pressed 2 times. 4 - Key pressed 3 times. 8 - Key Hold Down and Key Released. Default setting: 0 (none)

Value.label: S2 switch - scenes sent
Value.Help: This parameter determines which actions result in sending scene IDs assigned to them. 1 - Key pressed 1 time. 2 - Key pressed 2 times. 4 - Key pressed 3 times. 8 - Key Hold Down and Key Released. Default setting: 0 (none)

Value.label: S1 associations sent to 2nd and 3rd association groups
Value.Help: This parameter determines which actions are ignored when sending commands to devices associated in 2nd and 3rd association group. All actions are active by default. 1 - ignore turning On with 1 click of the switch. 2 - ignore turning OFF with 1 click of the switch. 4 - ignore holding and releasing the switch. 8 - ignore double click of the switch. Default setting: 0

Value.label: S1 Switch ON value sent to 2nd and 3rd association groups
Value.Help: This parameter determines value sent with Switch On command to devices associated in 2nd and 3rd association group.

Value.label: S1 Switch OFF value sent to 2nd and 3rd association groups
Value.Help: This parameter determines value sent with Switch Off command to devices associated in 2nd and 3rd association group.

Value.label: S1 Switch Double Click value sent to 2nd and 3rd association groups
Value.Help: This parameter determines value sent with Double Click command to devices associated in 2nd and 3rd association group.

Value.label: S2 associations sent to 4th and 5th association groups
Value.Help: This parameter determines which actions are ignored when sending commands to devices associated in 4th and 5th association group. All actions are active by default. 1 - ignore turning On with 1 click of the switch. 2 - ignore turning OFF with 1 click of the switch. 4 - ignore holding and releasing the switch. 8 - ignore double click of the switch. Default setting: 0

Value.label: S2 Switch ON value sent to 4th and 5th association groups
Value.Help: This parameter determines value sent with Switch On command to devices associated in 4th and 5th association group.

Value.label: S2 Switch OFF value sent to 4th and 5th association groups
Value.Help: This parameter determines value sent with Switch Off command to devices associated in 4th and 5th association group.

Value.label: S2 Switch Double Click value sent to 4th and 5th association groups
Value.Help: This parameter determines value sent with Double Click command to devices associated in 4th and 5th association group.

Value.label: Reaction to General Alarm
Value.Help: This parameter determines how the device will react to General Alarm frame.

Value.label: Reaction to Flood Alarm
Value.Help: This parameter determines how the device will react to Flood Alarm frame.

Value.label: Reaction to CO/CO2/Smoke Alarm
Value.Help: This parameter determines how the device will react to CO/CO2/Smoke Alarm frame.

Value.label: Reaction to Heat Alarm
Value.Help: This parameter determines how the device will react to Heat alarm frame.

Value.label: Flashing alarm duration
Value.Help: This parameter allows to set duration of flashing alarm mode. 1-32000 (0.1-32000s, 1s step) Default: 600 (10min)

Value.label: First channel - power reports
Value.Help: This parameter determines the minimum change in consumed power that will result in sending new power report to the main controller. 1-100 (%) Default 20 (20%)

Value.label: First channel - minimal time between power reports
Value.Help: This parameter determines minimum time that has to elapse before sending new power report to the main controller. 1-120 (s) Default 10 (10s)

Value.label: First channel - energy reports
Value.Help: This parameter determines the minimum change in consumed energy that will result in sending new energy report to the main controller. 1-32000 (0.01-320 kWh) Default 100 (1kWh)

Value.label: Periodic power reports
Value.Help: This parameter determines in what time interval the periodic power reports are sent to the main controller. 1-32000 (s) Default 3600 (1h)

Value.label: Periodic energy reports
Value.Help: This parameter determines in what time interval the periodic power reports are sent to the main controller. 1-32000 (s) Default 3600 (1h)

Value.label: Measuring energy consumed by the device itself
Value.Help: This parameter determines whether energy metering should include the amount of energy consumed by the device itself. Results are being added to energy reports for first endpoint.

Value.label: Minimum brightness level
Value.Help: Parameter is set automatically during the calibration process. Options for changing parameter 1-98. Default 1.

Value.label: Maximum brightness level
Value.Help: Parameter is set automatically during the calibration process. Options for changing parameter 2-99. Default 99.

Value.label: Incandescence level of dimmable compact fluorescent lamps
Value.Help: Virtual value set as a percentage level between parameters MIN (1%) and MAX. (99%). The Dimmer will set to this value after first switch on. It is required for warming up and switching dimmable compact fluorescent lamps and certain types of light sources. Options for changing parameter 1-99. Default 1.

Value.label: Incandescence time of dimmable compact fluorescent lamps
Value.Help: This parameter determines the time required for switching compact fluorescent lamps and certain types of light sources. Setting this parameter to 0 will disable the incandescence functionality. Available settings: 0-255 (0s - 25,5s)

Value.label: The percentage of a dimming step at automatic control
Value.Help: Available settings: 1-99 Default: 1

Value.label: Time of a dimming step at automatic control
Value.Help: Available settings: 0-255 (0s - 2,55s) Default setting: 1

Value.label: The percentage of a dimming step at manual control
Value.Help: Available settings: 1-99 Default: 1

Value.label: Time of a dimming step at manual control
Value.Help: Available settings: 0-255 (0s - 2,55s) Default setting: 1

Value.label: Saving state before power failure
Value.Help: Saving state before power failure. Default 1.

Item.label: State NOT saved at power failure, all outputs are set to OFF upon power restore
State saved at power failure, all outputs are set to previous state upon power restore

Value.label: Timer functionality (auto - off)
Value.Help: Available settings: 0 - Function disabled; 1-32767 - time to turn off measured in seconds (1s - 9,1h) Default setting: 0

Value.label: Enable/Disable ALL ON/OFF
Value.Help: Enable/Disable ALL ON/OFF. Default 255.

Item.label: ALL ON active / ALL OFF active
ALL ON disabled/ ALL OFF disabled
ALL ON disabled/ ALL OFF active
ALL ON active / ALL OFF disabled

Value.label: Force auto-calibration
Value.Help: Changing value of this parameter will force the calibration process.

Item.label: Start auto-calibration of the load without Fibaro Bypass
Start auto-calibration of the load with Fibaro Bypass

Value.label: Auto-calibration status
Value.Help: This parameter determines operating mode of the Dimmer (automatic/manual settings).

Item.label: calibration procedure not performed or Dimmer operates on manual settings

Value.label: Burnt out bulb detection
Value.Help: Function based on the sudden power variation of a specific value, interpreted as a LOAD ERROR. Available settings: 0 - function disabled; 1-99 - percentage value of power variation, compared to standard power consumption, measured during the calibration procedure (to be interpreted as load error/burnt out bulb) Default setting: 30

Value.label: Time delay of a burnt out bulb
Value.Help: Time of delay (in seconds) for power variation detection, interpreted as a LOAD ERROR or OVERLOAD detection (too much power connected to the Dimmer). Available settings: 0 - detection of a burnt out bulb disabled; 1-255 - delay time in seconds; Default setting: 5

Value.label: Forced switch on brightness level
Value.Help: If the parameter is active, switching on the Dimmer (S1 single click) will always set this brightness level. Available settings: 0 - function disabled; 1-99 - percentage level of brightness; Default setting: 0

Value.label: Inputs Button/Switch configuration
Value.Help: Binary inputs type configuration. Default 0.

Item.label: Role blind switch (UP / DOWN) - two switch keys operate the Dimmer

Value.label: The value sent to associated devices on single click
Value.Help: The value sent to associated devices on single click.

Item.label: 0xFF value is sent, which will set associated devices to their last saved state.
Current Dimmer state is sent, which will synchronize brightness level of associated devices (other Dimmers for example).

Value.label: Assign toggle switch status to the device status

Item.label: Device changes status on switch status change
Device status is synchronized with switch status

Value.label: Double click option
Value.Help: Double-click set lighting at 100%. Default 1.

Value.label: Command frames sent in 2-nd and 3-rd association groups (S1 associations)
Value.Help: Parameter determines, which actions will not result in sending frames to association groups. Parameter values may be combined, e.g. 1+2=3 means that associations on switching on or off the Dimmer (single click) will not be sent. Available settings: 0-31 0 - all actions send to association groups; 1 - do not send when switching on the Dimmer (single click); 2 - do not send when switching off the Dimmer (single click); 4 - do not send when changing dimming level (holding and releasing); 8 - do not send on double click; 16 - send 0xFF value on double click; Default setting: 0

Value.label: Command frames sent in 4-th and 5-th association groups (S2 associations)
Value.Help: Parameter determines, which actions will not result in sending frames to association groups. Parameter values may be combined, e.g. 1+2=3 means that associations on switching on or off the Dimmer (single click) will not be sent. Available settings: 0-31 0 - all actions send to association groups; 1 - do not send when switching on the Dimmer (single click); 2 - do not send when switching off the Dimmer (single click); 4 - do not send when changing dimming level (holding and releasing); 8 - do not send on double click; 16 - send 0xFF value on double click; Default setting: 0

Value.label: The function of 3-way switch
Value.Help: Switch no. 2 controls the Dimmer additionally (in 3-way switch mode). Function disabled for parameter 20 set to 2 (roller blind switch)

Value.label: Associations in Z-Wave network security mode
Value.Help: This parameter defines how commands are sent in specified association groups: as secure or non-secure. Parameter is active only in Z-Wave network security mode. It does not apply to 1st Lifeline group. Parameter values may be combined, e.g. 1+2=3 means that 2nd & 3rd group are sent as secure. Available settings: 0-15 0 - all groups (II-V) sent as non-secure; 1 - 2nd group sent as secure; 2 - 3rd group sent as secure; 4 - 4th group sent as secure; 8 - 5th group sent as secure; 15 - all groups (II-V) sent as secure; Default setting: 15

Value.label: Scene activation functionality
Value.Help: SCENE ID depends on the switch type configurations. Default 0.

Value.label: Switch functionality of S1 and S2

Item.label: S1 operates as S2, S2 operates as S1

Value.label: Load control mode
Value.Help: Forced auto-calibration will set this parameter value to 2.

Item.label: control mode selected automatically (based on auto-calibration)

Value.label: Load control mode
Value.Help: Load control mode recognized during auto-calibration.

Value.label: On/Off mode
Value.Help: Load control mode recognized during auto-calibration.

Item.label: on/off mode enabled (dimming is not possible)

Value.label: Dimmability of the load
Value.Help: Dimmability of the load

Value.label: Soft-Start functionality
Value.Help: Time required to warm up the filament of halogen bulb.

Value.label: Auto-calibration after power on
Value.Help: This parameter determines the trigger of auto-calibration procedure, e.g. power on, load error, etc.

Item.label: No auto-calibration of the load after power on
Auto-calibration performed after first power on
Auto-calibration performed after each power on
Auto-calibration performed after first power on or after each LOAD ERROR alarm (no load, load failure, burnt out bulb)
Auto-calibration performed after each power on or after each LOAD ERROR alarm (no load, load failure, burnt out bulb),

Value.Help: Behaviour of the Dimmer after OVERCURRENT or SURGE

Item.label: device permanently disabled until re-enabling by comand or external switch
three atempts to turn on the load

Value.label: Brightness level correction for flickering loads
Value.Help: Correction reduces spontaneous flickering of some capacitive load (e.g. dimmable lEDs) at certain brightness levels in 2-wire installation. In countries using ripple-control, correction may cause changes in brightness. In this case it is necessary to disable correction or adjust time of correction for flickering loads. Available settings: 0 - automatic correction disabled 1-254 - duration of correction in seconds 255 - automatic correction always enabled Default setting: 255

Value.label: Power limit - OVERLOAD
Value.Help: Reaching the defined value will result in turning off the load. Additional apparent power limit of 350VA is active by default. Available settings: 0 - functionality disabled; 1-350 - 1W-350W; Default setting: 250

Value.label: Response to General Purpose Alarm
Value.Help: Response to General Purpose Alarm; Default 3.

Item.label: No reaction - no response to alarm frames
ALARM DIMMER ON - device turn ON upon receipt of alarm frame
ALARM DIMMER OFF - device will turn OFF upon receipt of alarm frame
ALARM FLASHING - device will turn ON and OFF periodically

Value.Help: Response to Water Flooding Alarm; Default 2.

Value.Help: Response to Smoke, CO or CO2 Alarm; Default 3.

ALARM DIMMER OFF - device will turn OFF upon receipt of alarm frame
ALARM FLASHING - device will turn ON and OFF periodically

Value.Help: Alarm state may be cancelled earlier, as a result of pressing the switches or sending the Z-Wave command frame.

Value.label: OVERLOAD alarm report
Value.Help: OVERLOAD alarm report (load power consumption too high)

Value.label: LOAD ERROR alarm report
Value.Help: LOAD ERROR alarm report (no load, load failure, burnt out bulb)

Value.label: OVERCURRENT alarm report
Value.Help: OVERCURRENT alarm report (short circuit, burnt out bulb causing overcurrent)

Value.label: SURGE alarm report
Value.Help: SURGE alarm report (Dimmer output overvoltage)

Value.label: OVERHEAT and VOLTAGE DROP alarm report
Value.Help: OVERHEAT (critical temperature) and VOLTAGE DROP (low voltage) alarm report

Value.label: Active power reports
Value.Help: The parameter defines the power level change that will result in a new power report being sent. The value is a percentage of the previous report. Available settings: 0 - power reports disabled; 1-100 (1-100%) - power report threshold; Default setting: 10 (10%)

Value.label: Periodic active power and energy reports
Value.Help: Parameter 52 defines a time period between consecutive reports. Timer is reset and counted from zero after each report. Available settings: 0 - periodic reports disabled; 1-32767 (1-32767 seconds); Default setting: 3600 (3600s)

Value.label: Approximated power at the maximum brightness level
Value.Help: This parameter determines the approximate value of the power that will be reported by the device at its maximum brightness level. This parameter works only when parameter 58 has a value other than 0. Available settings: 0-500 (0-500W) - power consumed by the load at the maximum brightness level. Default setting: 0

Value.label: Self-measurement
Value.Help: The Dimmer may include active power and energy consumed by itself in reports sent to the main controller.

Value.label: Method of calculating the active power
Value.Help: This parameter defines how to calculate active power. This parameter is useful in a case of 2-wire connection with light sources other than resistive. The parameter is set to 0 after forced auto-calibration.

Item.label: power measurement based on the standard algorithm
approximation based on the calibration data
approximation based on the control angle

Value.label: Energy reports
Value.Help: Energy level change which will result in sending a new energy report. Available settings: 0 - energy reports disabled; 1-255 (0,01 - 2,55 kWh) - report triggering threshold; Default setting: 10 (0,1 kWh)

Value.Help: Available settings: 1-99 Default: 1

Value.Help: Available settings: 0-255 (0s - 2,55s) Default setting: 1

Value.label: Approximated power at the maximum brightness level
Value.Help: This parameter determines the approximate value of the power that will be reported by the device at its maximum brightness level. This parameter works only when parameter 58 has a value other than 0. Available settings: 0-500 (0-500W) - power consumed by the load at the maximum brightness level. Default setting: 0

Value.label: Self-measurement
Value.Help: The Dimmer may include active power and energy consumed by itself in reports sent to the main controller.

Value.label: Method of calculating the active power
Value.Help: This parameter defines how to calculate active power. This parameter is useful in a case of 2-wire connection with light sources other than resistive. The parameter is set to 0 after forced auto-calibration.

Item.label: power measurement based on the standard algorithm
approximation based on the calibration data
approximation based on the control angle

Value.label: Energy reports
Value.Help: Energy level change which will result in sending a new energy report. Available settings: 0 - energy reports disabled; 1-255 (0,01 - 2,55 kWh) - report triggering threshold; Default setting: 10 (0,1 kWh)

Value.label: Always on function
Value.Help: Once activated, Wall Plug will keep a connected device constantly ON, will stop reacting to alarm frames and B-button push. "Always on" function turns the Plug into a power and energy meter. Also, connected device will not be turned off upon receiving an alarm frame from another Z-Wave device (parameter 31 will be ignored). In "Always on" mode, connected device may be turned off only after user defined power has been exceeded (parameter 3). In such a case, connected device can be turned on again by pushing the B-button or sending a control frame. By default, overload protection is inactive. Default setting: 0

Value.label: Remember device status after a power failure
Value.Help: This parameter determines how the Wall Plug will react in the event of power supply failure (e.g. taking out from the electrical outlet). After the power supply is back on, the Wall Plug can be restored to previous state or remain switched off. This parameter is ignored in Always On mode - the device automatically turns ON after plugging it into the socket. Default setting: 1

Item.label: Wall Plug does not memorize its state after a power failure
Wall Plug memorizes its state after a power failure

Value.label: Overload safety switch
Value.Help: This function allows for turning off the controlled device in case of exceeding the defined power. Controlled device will be turned off even if "always on" function is active (parameter 1). Controlled device can be turned back on via B-button or sending a control frame. Available settings: 10 - 30000 (1,0W - 3000,0W step 0,1W). Default setting: 0 (function inactive)

Value.label: High priority power report
Value.Help: This parameter determines the minimum percentage change in active power that will result in sending power report to the main controller with the highest priority in the Z-Wave network. By default, the Wall Plug immediately sends the power report if the power load changes by 80%. Available settings: 1-99:power change in percent, 100:reports are disabled. Default setting: 80 (80%)

Value.label: Standard power load reporting
Value.Help: This parameter determines the minimum percentage change in active power that will result in sending power report to the main controller Compared to parameter 10, the maximum number of reports sent is reduced (parameter 12) to 5 in a specified time interval. In addition, the frames are not sent in EXPLORE mode, which prevents overloading the Z-Wave network. By default changes in power load may be reported up to 5 times per 30 seconds, when power load changes by 15%. Available settings: 1-99:power change in percent, 100:reports are disabled. Default setting: 15 (15%)

Value.label: Power reporting interval
Value.Help: This parameter defines how frequently standard power reports (parameter 11) will be sent. By default Wall Plug sends up to 5 reports each 30 seconds, provided the power load changes by 15%. Available setttings: 5-600 (in seconds). Default setting: 30 (s)

Value.label: Energy reporting threshold
Value.Help: This parameter specifies the minimum change in energy consumption (in relation to the previously reported), that will result in sending a new report. Available settings: 1-500 (0,01kWh - 5kWh). 0 - energy reports inactive. Default Setting: 10 (0,1 kWh)

Value.label: Power and energy periodic reports
Value.Help: This parameter defines time period between reports sent when changes in power load have not been recorded or if changes are insignificant (not exceeding values of parameters 20, 21 and 23). By default reports are sent every hour. Available settings: 5 - 32400 (s). 0 - periodic reports inactive. Reports will be sent only in case of power load / energy consumption changes (parameters 20,21,23) or in case of polling. Default setting: 3600

Value.label: Measuring energy consumed by the Wall Plug itself
Value.Help: This parameter determines whether energy metering should include the amount of energy consumed by the Wall Plug itself. Results are being added to energy consumed by controlled device. Default setting: 0

Value.label: Control of On/Off (button) association group(2) devices
Value.Help: Controlling devices with the B-Button. Control as the Wall Plug: switching the Wall Plug on switch the devices on (parameter 24) switching the Wall Plug off switch the devices off (parameter 24) This parameter is inactive in Always On mode (parameter 1). Default setting: 0

Value.label: DOWN value- On/Off(power) association group(3)
Value.Help: Lower power threshold, used in parameter 23. Available settings: 0 - 24900 (0,0W - 2490,0W step 0,1W) DOWN value cannot be higher than a value specified in parameter 22. Default setting: 300 (30W)

Value.label: UP value- On/Off(power) association group(3)
Value.Help: Upper power threshold, used in parameter 23. Available settings: 100 - 25000 (10,0W - 2500,0W) UP value cannot be lower than a value specified in parameter 21. Default setting: 500 (50W)

Value.label: The response after exceeding defined power values
Value.Help: Parameter defines the way 3th association group devices are controlled, depending on the actual measured power(as parameter 21 and 22 settings). Available settings: 1 - turn the associated devices ON, once the power drops below DOWN value (parameter 21), 2 - turn the associated devices OFF, once the power drops below DOWN value (parameter 21), 3 - turn the associated devices ON, once the power rises above UP value (parameter 22), 4 - turn the associated devices OFF, once the power rises above UP value (parameter 22), 5 - combination of 1 and 4. Turn the associated devices ON, once the power drops below DOWN value (parameter 21). Turn the associated devices OFF, once the power rises above UP value (parameter 22). 6 - combination of 2 and 3. Turn the associated devices OFF, once the power drops below DOWN value (parameter 21). Turn the associated devices ON, once the power rises above UP value (parameter 22). Default setting: 6

Item.label: Turn the associated devices on,Power below DOWN
Turn the associated devices off,Power below DOWN
Turn the associated devices on,Power above UP
Turn the associated devices off,Power above UP

Value.label: Switch ON value - On/Off association groups
Value.Help: The value of BASIC SET command frame sent to the devices associated in On/Off association groups (2, 3). On/Off (Button) association group - in accordance with parameter 20. On/Off (Power) association group - in accordance with parameter 23. Available settings: 0-99 and 255. Default setting: 255

Value.label: Active Alarms
Value.Help: Define Z-Wave network alarms to which the Wall Plug will respond.

Value.label: Response to alarm frames
Value.Help: This parameter defines how the Wall Plug will respond to alarms (device's status change). In case of values 1 or 2 the Wall Plug is operating normally and LED ring signals an alarm through time defined in parameter 32 or until the alarm is cancelled. In case of values 5 to 50 the Wall Plug does not report status change, power changes, ignores BASIC SET command frames. After time defined in parameter 32 or after the alarm cancellation, connected device is set to the previous state.. 0- no reaction 1-turn connected device on 2-turn connected device off 5-50(0,5-50,0s step 0,1s)-cyclically change device state with set period. Default setting:0-no reaction

Value.label: Alarm state duration
Value.Help: This parameter specifies the duration of alarm state. If a device sending an alarm frame through the Z-Wave network sets alarm duration as well, this settings are ignored. Available settings 1-32400(s) Default setting: 600

Value.label: Power load, which when exceeded, makes the LED ring flash violet.
Value.Help: Function is active only when parameter 41 is set to 0 or 1. Available settings: 1000 - 30000 (100,0W - 3000,0W, step 0,1W). Default setting: 25000 (2500W)

Value.label: LED ring illumination colour when controlled device is on
Value.Help: 0 - Illumination turned off completely, 1 - LED ring illumination colour changes continuously depending on active power, 2 - LED ring illumination colour changes in steps, depending on active power, 3 - White illumination, 4 - Red illumination, 5 - Green illumination, 6 - Blue illumination, 7 - Yellow illumination, 8 - Cyan illumination, 9 - Magenta illumination. Default setting: 1

Item.label: Colour changes continuously depending on active power
Colour changes in steps depending on active power

Value.label: LED ring illumination colour when controlled device is off
Value.Help: 0 - Illumination turned off completely, 1 - LED ring is illuminated with a colour corresponding to the last measured power, before the controlled device was turned off, 3 - White illumination, 4 - Red illumination, 5 - Green illumination, 6 - Blue illumination, 7 - Yellow illumination, 8 - Cyan illumination, 9 - Magenta illumination. Default setting: 0

Item.label: LED ring is illuminated with a colour corresponding to the last measured power

Value.label: LED ring illumination colour at the Z-Wave network alarm detection
Value.Help: 0 - illumination turned off completely, 1 - No change in colour. LED ring illumination colour determined by parameters 41 or 42 settings, 2 - LED ring flashes red/blue/white (default), 3 - White illumination, 4 - Red illumination, 5 - Green illumination, 6 - Blue illumination, 7 - Yellow illumination, 8 - Cyan illumination, 9 - Magenta illumination. Default setting: 2

Item.label: LED ring flashes red / blue / white

Value.label: Associations in Z-Wave network security mode
Value.Help: This parameter defines how commands are sent in specified association groups: as secure or non-secure. Parameter is active only in Z-Wave network security mode. This parameter does not apply to 1st Lifeline group. Available settings: 0-3: 0 - none of the groups are sent as secure; 1 - 2nd group sent as secure; 2 - 3rd group sent as secure; 3 - 2nd and 3rd group sent as secure; Default setting: 3

Item.label: none of the groups sent as secure

Value.label: Lock Mode - unlocking sequence
Value.Help: This parameter allows to activate Lock Mode and set up unlocking sequence. Device will lock after time set in parameter 2 or after pressing and holding selected button. 0 - Lock Mode disabled. 9-28086 - unlocking sequence. See "Lock Mode" on page 9 for more information.

Value.label: Lock Mode - time to lock and locking button
Value.Help: This parameter allows to set time that must elapse from the last press of the button to lock the device and locking button. Setting locking button will deactivate associations and scenes for pressing and holding the selected button. This parameter is irrelevant if parameter 1 is set to 0 (Lock Mode disable). 0 - Lock Mode disabled. 5-1791- calculated value. See "Lock Mode" on page 9 for more information

Value.label: First scene sequence
Value.Help: This parameter allows to set up sequence that activates scene with ID 7. 0 - 1st sequence disabled. 9-28086 - value of sequence. See "Sequences" on page 10 for more information.

Value.label: Second scene sequence
Value.Help: This parameter allows to set up sequence that activates scene with ID 8. 0 - 1st sequence disabled. 9-28086 - value of sequence. See "Sequences" on page 10 for more information.

Value.label: Third scene sequence
Value.Help: This parameter allows to set up sequence that activates scene with ID 9. 0 - 1st sequence disabled. 9-28086 - value of sequence. See "Sequences" on page 10 for more information.

Value.label: Fourth scene sequence
Value.Help: This parameter allows to set up sequence that activates scene with ID 10. 0 - 1st sequence disabled. 9-28086 - value of sequence. See "Sequences" on page 10 for more information.

Value.label: Fifth scene sequence
Value.Help: This parameter allows to set up sequence that activates scene with ID 11. 0 - 1st sequence disabled. 9-28086 - value of sequence. See "Sequences" on page 10 for more information.

Value.label: Sixth scene sequence
Value.Help: This parameter allows to set up sequence that activates scene with ID 12. 0 - 1st sequence disabled. 9-28086 - value of sequence. See "Sequences" on page 10 for more information.

Value.label: Sequences - timeout
Value.Help: This parameter allows to set time that must elapse from the last press of the button to check if the sequence is valid. Available settings: 5-30 (0.5-3s, 0.1s step) - time to lock

Value.label: Single button associations - operating mode
Value.Help: This parameter allows to choose operating mode for single button associations.

Item.label: Single press switches state to opposite
Single press switches state to opposite, double press sets to maximum level
Single press turns on, double press turns off

Value.label: Value sent to Square association group
Value.Help: This parameter allows to set value sent to devices in association group. It will result in turning multilevel devices on with set or last level. Value is irrelevant for simple on/off devices. Available settings: 1-99 or 255.

Value.label: Value sent to Circle association group
Value.Help: This parameter allows to set value sent to devices in association group. It will result in turning multilevel devices on with set or last level. Value is irrelevant for simple on/off devices. Available settings: 1-99 or 255.

Value.label: Value sent to Cross association group
Value.Help: This parameter allows to set value sent to devices in association group. It will result in turning multilevel devices on with set or last level. Value is irrelevant for simple on/off devices. Available settings: 1-99 or 255.

Value.label: Value sent to Triangle association group
Value.Help: This parameter allows to set value sent to devices in association group. It will result in turning multilevel devices on with set or last level. Value is irrelevant for simple on/off devices. Available settings: 1-99 or 255.

Value.label: Value sent to Minus association group
Value.Help: This parameter allows to set value sent to devices in association group. It will result in turning multilevel devices on with set or last level. Value is irrelevant for simple on/off devices. Available settings: 1-99 or 255.

Value.label: Value sent to Plus association group
Value.Help: This parameter allows to set value sent to devices in association group. It will result in turning multilevel devices on with set or last level. Value is irrelevant for simple on/off devices. Available settings: 1-99 or 255.

Value.label: Paired buttons association for Square and Circle
Value.Help: This parameter allows to activate paired buttons association mode for Square and Circle buttons. Paired buttons are dependent and association are sent only to Square groups. Circle turns devices on and increases value, Square turns them off and decreases value.

Value.label: Paired buttons association for Cross and Triangle
Value.Help: This parameter allows to activate paired buttons association mode for Cross and Triangle buttons. Paired buttons are dependent and association are sent only to Cross groups. Triangle turns devices on and increases value, Cross turns them off and decreases value.

Value.label: Paired buttons association for Minus and Plus
Value.Help: This parameter allows to activate paired buttons association mode for Minus and Plus buttons. Paired buttons are dependent and association are sent only to Minus groups. Plus turns devices on and increases value, Minus turns them off and decreases value.

Value.label: Scene activation for Square button
Value.Help: This parameter determines which actions result in sending assigned scene IDs and attributes to the controller. 1 - Key Pressed 1 time. 2 - Key Pressed 2 times. 4 - Key Pressed 3 times. 8 - Key Held Down and Released. Default setting: 9, 1x and hold.

Value.label: Scene activation for Circle button
Value.Help: This parameter determines which actions result in sending assigned scene IDs and attributes to the controller. 1 - Key Pressed 1 time. 2 - Key Pressed 2 times. 4 - Key Pressed 3 times. 8 - Key Held Down and Released. Default setting: 9, 1x and hold.

Value.label: Scene activation for Cross button
Value.Help: This parameter determines which actions result in sending assigned scene IDs and attributes to the controller. 1 - Key Pressed 1 time. 2 - Key Pressed 2 times. 4 - Key Pressed 3 times. 8 - Key Held Down and Released. Default setting: 9, 1x and hold.

Value.label: Scene activation for Triangle button
Value.Help: This parameter determines which actions result in sending assigned scene IDs and attributes to the controller. 1 - Key Pressed 1 time. 2 - Key Pressed 2 times. 4 - Key Pressed 3 times. 8 - Key Held Down and Released. Default setting: 9, 1x and hold.

Value.label: Scene activation for Minus button
Value.Help: This parameter determines which actions result in sending assigned scene IDs and attributes to the controller. 1 - Key Pressed 1 time. 2 - Key Pressed 2 times. 4 - Key Pressed 3 times. 8 - Key Held Down and Released. Default setting: 9, 1x and hold.

Value.label: Scene activation for Plus button
Value.Help: This parameter determines which actions result in sending assigned scene IDs and attributes to the controller. 1 - Key Pressed 1 time. 2 - Key Pressed 2 times. 4 - Key Pressed 3 times. 8 - Key Held Down and Released. Default setting: 9, 1x and hold.

Value.label: Associations in Z-Wave network Security Mode
Value.Help: Parameter defines how commands are sent in specified association groups: using Security Mode or not. Parameter is active only in Z-Wave network Security Mode. It does not apply to 1st Lifeline association group. 1 : 2nd group sent using Security Mode. 2 : 3rd group sent using Security Mode. 4 : 4th group sent using Security Mode. 8 : 5th group sent using Security Mode. 16 : 6th group sent using Security Mode. 32 : 7th group sent using Security Mode. 64 : 8th group sent using Security Mode. 128 : 9th group sent using Security Mode. 256 : 10th group sent using Security Mode. 512 : 11th group sent using Security Mode. 1024 : 12th group sent using Security Mode. 2048 : 13th group sent using Security Mode.

Value.label: Scenes sent to the controller
Value.Help: This parameter determines which actions result in sending scene IDs and attributes assigned to them. 1 - Key Pressed 1 time. 2 - Key Pressed 2 times. 4 - Key Pressed 3 times. 8 - Key Pressed 4 times. 16 - Key Pressed 5 times. 32 - Key Held Down. 64 - Key Released. Note: Values of parameter 1 may be combined, e.g. 1+2=3 means that scenes will be sent after pressing the button once or twice. Default: 127 All.

Value.label: Associations in Z-Wave network security mode
Value.Help: This parameter defines how commands are sent in specified association groups: as secure or non-secure. Parameter is active only in Z-Wave network security mode. It does not apply to 1st Lifeline group. 1 - 2nd group sent as secure. 2 - 3rd group sent as secure. 4 - 4th group sent as secure. Default: 3 All.

Value.label: Key Pressed 1 time - command sent to 2nd association group
Value.Help: This parameter defines commands sent to devices associated in 2nd association group after a single click

Value.label: Key Pressed 1 times - value of SWITCH ON command sent to 2nd association group
Value.Help: This parameter defines value of SWITCH ON command sent to devices in 2nd association group after a single click.

Value.label: Key Pressed 2 time - command sent to 2nd association group
Value.Help: This parameter defines commands sent to devices associated in 2nd association group after a double click

Value.label: Key Pressed 2 times - value of SWITCH ON command sent to 2nd association group
Value.Help: This parameter defines value of SWITCH ON command sent to devices in 2nd association group after a double click.

Value.label: Key Pressed 3 time - command sent to 2nd association group
Value.Help: This parameter defines commands sent to devices associated in 2nd association group after a triple click

Value.label: Key Pressed 3 times - value of SWITCH ON command sent to 2nd association group
Value.Help: This parameter defines value of SWITCH ON command sent to devices in 2nd association group after a triple click.

Value.label: Key Pressed 1 time - command sent to 3rd association group
Value.Help: This parameter defines commands sent to devices associated in 2nd association group after a single click

Value.label: Key Pressed 1 times - value of SWITCH ON command sent to 3rd association group
Value.Help: This parameter defines value of SWITCH ON command sent to devices in 3rd association group after a single click.

Value.label: Key Pressed 2 time - command sent to 3rd association group
Value.Help: This parameter defines commands sent to devices associated in 3rd association group after a double click

Value.label: Key Pressed 2 times - value of SWITCH ON command sent to 3rd association group
Value.Help: This parameter defines value of SWITCH ON command sent to devices in 3rd association group after a double click.

Value.label: Key Pressed 3 time - command sent to 3rd association group
Value.Help: This parameter defines commands sent to devices associated in 3rd association group after a triple click

Value.label: Key Pressed 3 times - value of SWITCH ON command sent to 3rd association group
Value.Help: This parameter defines value of SWITCH ON command sent to devices in 3rd association group after a triple click.

Value.label: Key Held Down - command sent to 3rd association group
Value.Help: This parameter defines commands sent to devices associated in 3rd association group after holding the button down.

Value.label: Alarm frame triggers
Value.Help: Parameter determines which actions result in sending alarm frames to 4th association group. 1 - Key Pressed 1 time. 2 - Key Pressed 2 times. 4 - Key Pressed 3 times. 8 - Key Pressed 4 times. 16 - Key Pressed 5 times. 32 - Key Held Down. 64 - Key Released. Default: 127 All.

Value.label: Minimum brightness level
Value.Help: Parameter is set automatically during the calibration process. Options for changing parameter 1-98. Default 1.

Value.label: Maximum brightness level
Value.Help: Parameter is set automatically during the calibration process. Options for changing parameter 2-99. Default 99.

Value.label: Incandescence level of dimmable compact fluorescent lamps
Value.Help: Virtual value set as a percentage level between parameters MIN (1%) and MAX. (99%). The Dimmer will set to this value after first switch on. It is required for warming up and switching dimmable compact fluorescent lamps and certain types of light sources. Options for changing parameter 1-99. Default 1.

Value.label: Incandescence time of dimmable compact fluorescent lamps
Value.Help: This parameter determines the time required for switching compact fluorescent lamps and certain types of light sources. Setting this parameter to 0 will disable the incandescence functionality. Available settings: 0-255 (0s - 25,5s)

Value.label: The percentage of a dimming step at automatic control
Value.Help: Available settings: 1-99 Default: 1

Value.label: Time of a dimming step at automatic control
Value.Help: Available settings: 0-255 (0s - 2,55s) Default setting: 1

Value.label: The percentage of a dimming step at manual control
Value.Help: Available settings: 1-99 Default: 1

Value.label: Time of a dimming step at manual control
Value.Help: Available settings: 0-255 (0s - 2,55s) Default setting: 1

Value.label: Saving state before power failure
Value.Help: Saving state before power failure. Default 1.

Item.label: State NOT saved at power failure, all outputs are set to OFF upon power restore
State saved at power failure, all outputs are set to previous state upon power restore

Value.label: Timer functionality (auto - off)
Value.Help: Available settings: 0 - Function disabled; 1-32767 - time to turn off measured in seconds (1s - 9,1h) Default setting: 0

Value.label: Enable/Disable ALL ON/OFF
Value.Help: Enable/Disable ALL ON/OFF. Default 255.

Item.label: ALL ON active / ALL OFF active
ALL ON disabled/ ALL OFF disabled
ALL ON disabled/ ALL OFF active
ALL ON active / ALL OFF disabled

Value.label: Force auto-calibration
Value.Help: Changing value of this parameter will force the calibration process.

Item.label: Start auto-calibration of the load without Fibaro Bypass
Start auto-calibration of the load with Fibaro Bypass

Value.label: Auto-calibration status
Value.Help: This parameter determines operating mode of the Dimmer (automatic/manual settings).

Item.label: calibration procedure not performed or Dimmer operates on manual settings

Value.label: Burnt out bulb detection
Value.Help: Function based on the sudden power variation of a specific value, interpreted as a LOAD ERROR. Available settings: 0 - function disabled; 1-99 - percentage value of power variation, compared to standard power consumption, measured during the calibration procedure (to be interpreted as load error/burnt out bulb) Default setting: 30

Value.label: Time delay of a burnt out bulb
Value.Help: Time of delay (in seconds) for power variation detection, interpreted as a LOAD ERROR or OVERLOAD detection (too much power connected to the Dimmer). Available settings: 0 - detection of a burnt out bulb disabled; 1-255 - delay time in seconds; Default setting: 5

Value.label: Forced switch on brightness level
Value.Help: If the parameter is active, switching on the Dimmer (S1 single click) will always set this brightness level. Available settings: 0 - function disabled; 1-99 - percentage level of brightness; Default setting: 0

Value.label: Inputs Button/Switch configuration
Value.Help: Binary inputs type configuration. Default 0.

Item.label: Role blind switch (UP / DOWN) - two switch keys operate the Dimmer

Value.label: The value sent to associated devices on single click
Value.Help: The value sent to associated devices on single click.

Item.label: 0xFF value is sent, which will set associated devices to their last saved state.
Current Dimmer state is sent, which will synchronize brightness level of associated devices (other Dimmers for example).

Value.label: Assign toggle switch status to the device status

Item.label: Device changes status on switch status change
Device status is synchronized with switch status

Value.label: Double click option
Value.Help: Double-click set lighting at 100%. Default 1.

Value.label: Command frames sent in 2-nd and 3-rd association groups (S1 associations)
Value.Help: Parameter determines, which actions will not result in sending frames to association groups. Parameter values may be combined, e.g. 1+2=3 means that associations on switching on or off the Dimmer (single click) will not be sent. Available settings: 0-31 0 - all actions send to association groups; 1 - do not send when switching on the Dimmer (single click); 2 - do not send when switching off the Dimmer (single click); 4 - do not send when changing dimming level (holding and releasing); 8 - do not send on double click; 16 - send 0xFF value on double click; Default setting: 0

Value.label: Command frames sent in 4-th and 5-th association groups (S2 associations)
Value.Help: Parameter determines, which actions will not result in sending frames to association groups. Parameter values may be combined, e.g. 1+2=3 means that associations on switching on or off the Dimmer (single click) will not be sent. Available settings: 0-31 0 - all actions send to association groups; 1 - do not send when switching on the Dimmer (single click); 2 - do not send when switching off the Dimmer (single click); 4 - do not send when changing dimming level (holding and releasing); 8 - do not send on double click; 16 - send 0xFF value on double click; Default setting: 0

Value.label: The function of 3-way switch
Value.Help: Switch no. 2 controls the Dimmer additionally (in 3-way switch mode). Function disabled for parameter 20 set to 2 (roller blind switch)

Value.label: Associations in Z-Wave network security mode
Value.Help: This parameter defines how commands are sent in specified association groups: as secure or non-secure. Parameter is active only in Z-Wave network security mode. It does not apply to 1st Lifeline group. Parameter values may be combined, e.g. 1+2=3 means that 2nd & 3rd group are sent as secure. Available settings: 0-15 0 - all groups (II-V) sent as non-secure; 1 - 2nd group sent as secure; 2 - 3rd group sent as secure; 4 - 4th group sent as secure; 8 - 5th group sent as secure; 15 - all groups (II-V) sent as secure; Default setting: 15

Value.label: Scene activation functionality
Value.Help: SCENE ID depends on the switch type configurations. Default 0.

Value.label: Switch functionality of S1 and S2

Item.label: S1 operates as S2, S2 operates as S1

Value.label: Load control mode
Value.Help: Forced auto-calibration will set this parameter value to 2.

Item.label: control mode selected automatically (based on auto-calibration)

Value.label: Load control mode
Value.Help: Load control mode recognized during auto-calibration.

Value.label: On/Off mode
Value.Help: Load control mode recognized during auto-calibration.

Item.label: on/off mode enabled (dimming is not possible)

Value.label: Dimmability of the load
Value.Help: Dimmability of the load

Value.label: Soft-Start functionality
Value.Help: Time required to warm up the filament of halogen bulb.

Value.label: Auto-calibration after power on
Value.Help: This parameter determines the trigger of auto-calibration procedure, e.g. power on, load error, etc.

Item.label: No auto-calibration of the load after power on
Auto-calibration performed after first power on
Auto-calibration performed after each power on
Auto-calibration performed after first power on or after each LOAD ERROR alarm (no load, load failure, burnt out bulb)
Auto-calibration performed after each power on or after each LOAD ERROR alarm (no load, load failure, burnt out bulb),

Value.label: Behaviour of the Dimmer after OVERCURRENT or SURGE
Value.Help: Behaviour of the Dimmer after OVERCURRENT or SURGE

Item.label: device permanently disabled until re-enabling by comand or external switch
three attempts to turn on the load

Value.label: Brightness level correction for flickering loads
Value.Help: Correction reduces spontaneous flickering of some capacitive load (e.g. dimmable lEDs) at certain brightness levels in 2-wire installation. In countries using ripple-control, correction may cause changes in brightness. In this case it is necessary to disable correction or adjust time of correction for flickering loads. Available settings: 0 - automatic correction disabled 1-254 - duration of correction in seconds 255 - automatic correction always enabled Default setting: 255

Value.label: Power limit - OVERLOAD
Value.Help: Reaching the defined value will result in turning off the load. Additional apparent power limit of 350VA is active by default. Available settings: 0 - functionality disabled; 1-350 - 1W-350W; Default setting: 250

Value.label: Response to General Purpose Alarm
Value.Help: Response to General Purpose Alarm; Default 3.

Item.label: No reaction - no response to alarm frames
ALARM DIMMER ON - device turn ON upon receipt of alarm frame
ALARM DIMMER OFF - device will turn OFF upon receipt of alarm frame
ALARM FLASHING - device will turn ON and OFF periodically

Value.label: Response to Water Flooding Alarm
Value.Help: Response to Water Flooding Alarm; Default 2.

Item.label: No reaction - no response to alarm frames
ALARM DIMMER ON - device turn ON upon receipt of alarm frame
ALARM DIMMER OFF - device will turn OFF upon receipt of alarm frame
ALARM FLASHING - device will turn ON and OFF periodically

Value.label: Response to Smoke, CO or CO2 Alarm
Value.Help: Response to Smoke, CO or CO2 Alarm; Default 3.

Item.label: No reaction - no response to alarm frames
ALARM DIMMER ON - device turn ON upon receipt of alarm frame
ALARM DIMMER OFF - device will turn OFF upon receipt of alarm frame
ALARM FLASHING - device will turn ON and OFF periodically

Value.label: Response to Temperature Alarm
Value.Help: Response to Temperature Alarm; Default 1.

Item.label: No reaction - no response to alarm frames
ALARM DIMMER ON - device turn ON upon receipt of alarm frame
ALARM DIMMER OFF - device will turn OFF upon receipt of alarm frame
ALARM FLASHING - device will turn ON and OFF periodically

Value.label: Time of alarm state
Value.Help: Alarm state may be cancelled earlier, as a result of pressing the switches or sending the Z-Wave command frame.

Value.label: OVERLOAD alarm report
Value.Help: OVERLOAD alarm report (load power consumption too high)

Value.label: LOAD ERROR alarm report
Value.Help: LOAD ERROR alarm report (no load, load failure, burnt out bulb)

Value.label: OVERCURRENT alarm report
Value.Help: OVERCURRENT alarm report (short circuit, burnt out bulb causing overcurrent)

Value.label: SURGE alarm report
Value.Help: SURGE alarm report (Dimmer output overvoltage)

Value.label: OVERHEAT and VOLTAGE DROP alarm report
Value.Help: OVERHEAT (critical temperature) and VOLTAGE DROP (low voltage) alarm report

Value.label: Active power reports
Value.Help: The parameter defines the power level change that will result in a new power report being sent. The value is a percentage of the previous report. Available settings: 0 - power reports disabled; 1-100 (1-100%) - power report threshold; Default setting: 10 (10%)

Value.label: Periodic active power and energy reports
Value.Help: Parameter 52 defines a time period between consecutive reports. Timer is reset and counted from zero after each report. Available settings: 0 - periodic reports disabled; 1-32767 (1-32767 seconds); Default setting: 3600 (3600s)

Value.label: Energy reports
Value.Help: Energy level change which will result in sending a new energy report. Available settings: 0 - energy reports disabled; 1-255 (0,01 - 2,55 kWh) - report triggering threshold; Default setting: 10 (0,1 kWh)

Value.label: Self-measurement
Value.Help: The Dimmer may include active power and energy consumed by itself in reports sent to the main controller.

Value.label: Method of calculating the active power
Value.Help: This parameter defines how to calculate active power. This parameter is useful in a case of 2-wire connection with light sources other than resistive. The parameter is set to 0 after forced auto-calibration.

Item.label: power measurement based on the standard algorithm
approximation based on the calibration data
approximation based on the control angle

Value.label: Approximated power at the maximum brightness level
Value.Help: This parameter determines the approximate value of the power that will be reported by the device at its maximum brightness level. This parameter works only when parameter 58 has a value other than 0. Available settings: 0-500 (0-500W) - power consumed by the load at the maximum brightness level. Default setting: 0

Value.label: Minimum brightness level
Value.Help: Parameter is set automatically during the calibration process. Options for changing parameter 1-98. Default 1.

Value.label: Maximum brightness level
Value.Help: Parameter is set automatically during the calibration process. Options for changing parameter 2-99. Default 99.

Value.label: Incandescence level of dimmable compact fluorescent lamps
Value.Help: Virtual value set as a percentage level between parameters MIN (1%) and MAX. (99%). The Dimmer will set to this value after first switch on. It is required for warming up and switching dimmable compact fluorescent lamps and certain types of light sources. Options for changing parameter 1-99. Default 1.

Value.label: Incandescence time of dimmable compact fluorescent lamps
Value.Help: This parameter determines the time required for switching compact fluorescent lamps and certain types of light sources. Setting this parameter to 0 will disable the incandescence functionality. Available settings: 0-255 (0s - 25,5s)

Value.label: The percentage of a dimming step at automatic control
Value.Help: Available settings: 1-99 Default: 1

Value.label: Time of a dimming step at automatic control
Value.Help: Available settings: 0-255 (0s - 2,55s) Default setting: 1

Value.label: The percentage of a dimming step at manual control
Value.Help: Available settings: 1-99 Default: 1

Value.label: Time of a dimming step at manual control
Value.Help: Available settings: 0-255 (0s - 2,55s) Default setting: 1

Value.label: Saving state before power failure
Value.Help: Saving state before power failure. Default 1.

Item.label: State NOT saved at power failure, all outputs are set to OFF upon power restore
State saved at power failure, all outputs are set to previous state upon power restore

Value.label: Timer functionality (auto - off)
Value.Help: Available settings: 0 - Function disabled; 1-32767 - time to turn off measured in seconds (1s - 9,1h) Default setting: 0

Value.label: Enable/Disable ALL ON/OFF
Value.Help: Enable/Disable ALL ON/OFF. Default 255.

Item.label: ALL ON active / ALL OFF active
ALL ON disabled/ ALL OFF disabled
ALL ON disabled/ ALL OFF active
ALL ON active / ALL OFF disabled

Value.label: Force auto-calibration
Value.Help: Changing value of this parameter will force the calibration process.

Item.label: Start auto-calibration of the load without Fibaro Bypass
Start auto-calibration of the load with Fibaro Bypass

Value.label: Auto-calibration status
Value.Help: This parameter determines operating mode of the Dimmer (automatic/manual settings).

Item.label: calibration procedure not performed or Dimmer operates on manual settings

Value.label: Burnt out bulb detection
Value.Help: Function based on the sudden power variation of a specific value, interpreted as a LOAD ERROR. Available settings: 0 - function disabled; 1-99 - percentage value of power variation, compared to standard power consumption, measured during the calibration procedure (to be interpreted as load error/burnt out bulb) Default setting: 30

Value.label: Time delay of a burnt out bulb
Value.Help: Time of delay (in seconds) for power variation detection, interpreted as a LOAD ERROR or OVERLOAD detection (too much power connected to the Dimmer). Available settings: 0 - detection of a burnt out bulb disabled; 1-255 - delay time in seconds; Default setting: 5

Value.label: Forced switch on brightness level
Value.Help: If the parameter is active, switching on the Dimmer (S1 single click) will always set this brightness level. Available settings: 0 - function disabled; 1-99 - percentage level of brightness; Default setting: 0

Value.label: Inputs Button/Switch configuration
Value.Help: Binary inputs type configuration. Default 0.

Item.label: Role blind switch (UP / DOWN) - two switch keys operate the Dimmer

Value.label: The value sent to associated devices on single click
Value.Help: The value sent to associated devices on single click.

Item.label: 0xFF value is sent, which will set associated devices to their last saved state.
Current Dimmer state is sent, which will synchronize brightness level of associated devices (other Dimmers for example).

Value.label: Assign toggle switch status to the device status

Item.label: Device changes status on switch status change
Device status is synchronized with switch status

Value.label: Double click option
Value.Help: Double-click set lighting at 100%. Default 1.

Value.label: Command frames sent in 2-nd and 3-rd association groups (S1 associations)
Value.Help: Parameter determines, which actions will not result in sending frames to association groups. Parameter values may be combined, e.g. 1+2=3 means that associations on switching on or off the Dimmer (single click) will not be sent. Available settings: 0-31 0 - all actions send to association groups; 1 - do not send when switching on the Dimmer (single click); 2 - do not send when switching off the Dimmer (single click); 4 - do not send when changing dimming level (holding and releasing); 8 - do not send on double click; 16 - send 0xFF value on double click; Default setting: 0

Value.label: Command frames sent in 4-th and 5-th association groups (S2 associations)
Value.Help: Parameter determines, which actions will not result in sending frames to association groups. Parameter values may be combined, e.g. 1+2=3 means that associations on switching on or off the Dimmer (single click) will not be sent. Available settings: 0-31 0 - all actions send to association groups; 1 - do not send when switching on the Dimmer (single click); 2 - do not send when switching off the Dimmer (single click); 4 - do not send when changing dimming level (holding and releasing); 8 - do not send on double click; 16 - send 0xFF value on double click; Default setting: 0

Value.label: The function of 3-way switch
Value.Help: Switch no. 2 controls the Dimmer additionally (in 3-way switch mode). Function disabled for parameter 20 set to 2 (roller blind switch)

Value.label: Associations in Z-Wave network security mode
Value.Help: This parameter defines how commands are sent in specified association groups: as secure or non-secure. Parameter is active only in Z-Wave network security mode. It does not apply to 1st Lifeline group. Parameter values may be combined, e.g. 1+2=3 means that 2nd & 3rd group are sent as secure. Available settings: 0-15 0 - all groups (II-V) sent as non-secure; 1 - 2nd group sent as secure; 2 - 3rd group sent as secure; 4 - 4th group sent as secure; 8 - 5th group sent as secure; 15 - all groups (II-V) sent as secure; Default setting: 15

Value.label: Scene activation functionality
Value.Help: SCENE ID depends on the switch type configurations. Default 0.

Item.label: S1 operates as S2, S2 operates as S1

Value.label: Brightness level correction for flickering loads
Value.Help: Correction reduces spontaneous flickering of some capacitive load (e.g. dimmable lEDs) at certain brightness levels in 2-wire installation. In countries using ripple-control, correction may cause changes in brightness. In this case it is necessary to disable correction or adjust time of correction for flickering loads. Available settings: 0 - automatic correction disabled 1-254 - duration of correction in seconds 255 - automatic correction always enabled Default setting: 255

Value.label: S1 switch - scenes sent
Value.Help: This parameter determines which actions result in sending scene IDs assigned to them. 1 - Key pressed 1 time. 2 - Key pressed 2 times. 4 - Key pressed 3 times. 8 - Key Hold Down and Key Released. Default setting: 0 (none)

Value.label: S2 switch - scenes sent
Value.Help: This parameter determines which actions result in sending scene IDs assigned to them. 1 - Key pressed 1 time. 2 - Key pressed 2 times. 4 - Key pressed 3 times. 8 - Key Hold Down and Key Released. Default setting: 0 (none)

Value.label: S1 associations sent to 2nd and 3rd association groups
Value.Help: This parameter determines which actions are ignored when sending commands to devices associated in 2nd and 3rd association group. All actions are active by default. 1 - ignore turning On with 1 click of the switch. 2 - ignore turning OFF with 1 click of the switch. 4 - ignore holding and releasing the switch. 8 - ignore double click of the switch. Default setting: 0

Value.label: S1 Switch ON value sent to 2nd and 3rd association groups
Value.Help: This parameter determines value sent with Switch On command to devices associated in 2nd and 3rd association group.

Value.label: S1 Switch OFF value sent to 2nd and 3rd association groups

Value.Help: This parameter determines value sent with Double Click command to devices associated in 2nd and 3rd association group.

Value.label: S2 associations sent to 4th and 5th association groups

All actions are active by default. 1 - ignore turning On with 1 click of the switch. 2 - ignore turning OFF with 1 click of the switch. 4 - ignore holding and releasing the switch. 8 - ignore double click of the switch. Default setting: 0

Value.label: S2 Switch ON value sent to 4th and 5th association groups
Value.Help: This parameter determines value sent with Switch On command to devices associated in 4th and 5th association group.

Value.label: S2 Switch OFF value sent to 4th and 5th association groups

Value.Help: This parameter determines value sent with Double Click command to devices associated in 4th and 5th association group.

Value.Help: This parameter determines how the device will react to General Alarm frame.

Value.Help: This parameter determines how the device will react to Flood Alarm frame.

Value.label: Reaction to CO/CO2/Smoke Alarm
Value.Help: This parameter determines how the device will react to CO/CO2/Smoke Alarm frame.

Value.label: Reaction to Heat Alarm
Value.Help: This parameter determines how the device will react to Heat alarm frame.

Value.label: Flashing alarm duration
Value.Help: This parameter allows to set duration of flashing alarm mode. 1-32000 (0.1-32000s, 1s step) Default: 600 (10min)

Value.label: First channel - power reports
Value.Help: This parameter determines the minimum change in consumed power that will result in sending new power report to the main controller. 1-100 (%) Default 20 (20%)

Value.label: First channel - minimal time between power reports
Value.Help: This parameter determines minimum time that has to elapse before sending new power report to the main controller. 1-120 (s) Default 10 (10s)

Value.label: First channel - energy reports
Value.Help: This parameter determines the minimum change in consumed energy that will result in sending new energy report to the main controller. 1-32000 (0.01-320 kWh) Default 100 (1kWh)

Value.label: Periodic power reports
Value.Help: This parameter determines in what time interval the periodic power reports are sent to the main controller. 1-32000 (s) Default 3600 (1h)

Value.label: Periodic energy reports
Value.Help: This parameter determines in what time interval the periodic power reports are sent to the main controller. 1-32000 (s) Default 3600 (1h)

Value.label: Measuring energy consumed by the device itself
Value.Help: This parameter determines whether energy metering should include the amount of energy consumed by the device itself. Results are being added to energy reports for first endpoint.

Value.label: Wake up 10 minutes on Power On
Value.Help: Enable/Disable waking up for 10 minutes when re-power on (battery mode) the MultiSensor

Value.label: On time
Value.Help: Duration that the motion sensor must observe no motion before it will return to the no-motion state. If value greater than 255, effective value is rounded up to the nearest minute (255 -> 255 seconds, 256 -> 300 seconds)

Value.label: Enable Motion Sensor
Value.Help: Enable Motion Sensor, (1 minimum, 5 maximum sensitivity level)

Value.label: Command Options
Value.Help: Which commands to send when PIR motion sensor triggered OZW Ideal Value is Binary Sensor Report

Value.label: Awake timeout
Value.Help: Set the timeout of awake after the Wake Up CC is sent out. Available rang: 8 to 255 seconds.

Value.label: Current power mode
Value.Help: Report the current power mode and the product state for battery power mode

Item.label: USB power, sleeping mode after re-power on
USB power, keep awake for 10 minutes after re-power on
Battery power, sleeping mode after re-power on
Battery power, keep awake for 10 minutes after re-power on

Value.label: Low Battery
Value.Help: Configure low battery value Value=10 to 50.

Value.label: Report Only On Thresholds
Value.Help: Enable/disable the selective reporting only when measurements reach a certain threshold or percentage set in the threshold settings. This is used to reduce network traffic.

Value.label: Temperature Reporting Threshold
Value.Help: Threshold change in temperature to induce an automatic report. Note: 1. The unit is Fahrenheit for US version, Celsius for EU/AU version. 2. The value contains one decimal point. E.g. if the value is set to 20, the threshold value = 2.0 C (EU/AU) or 2.0 F (US). When the temperature has changed by 2.0 (of the appropriate unit), a temperature report will be sent.

Value.label: Humidity Reporting Threshold
Value.Help: Threshold change in humidity to induce an automatic report. Note: 1. The unit is %. 2. The default value is 10, which means that a 10% change in humidity will trigger a report.

Value.label: Luminance Reporting Threshold
Value.Help: Threshold change in luminance to induce an automatic report.

Value.label: Battery Reporting Threshold
Value.Help: Threshold change in battery level to induce an automatic report. Note: 1. The unit is %. 2. The default value is 10, which means that a 10% change in battery will trigger a report.

Value.label: UV Reporting Threshold
Value.Help: Threshold change in ultraviolet to induce an automatic report.

Value.label: Low Temp Alarm
Value.Help: Enable/disable to send the alarm report of low temperature(Less than 15 Degress C)

Value.label: Enable/disable to send a report on Threshold
Value.Help: Enable/disable to send a report when the measurement is more than the upper limit value or less than the lower limit value. Bit mask = 0, disable. Bit mask = 1, enable. Bit 0 = temperature. Bit 1 = humidity. Bit 2 = luminance. Bit 3 = ultraviolet. The above bit masks are used to enable/disable to send out a report when the measurement is less than the lower limit value. The below bit masks are used to enable/disable to send out a report when the measurement is more than the upper limit value. Bit 4 = temperature. Bit 5 = humidity. Bit 6 = luminance. Bit 7 = ultraviolet. Note: If USB power, the Sensor will check the limit every 10 seconds. If battery power, the Sensor will check the limit when it is waken up.

Value.label: Set the upper limit value of temperature sensor
Value.Help: When the measurement is more than this upper limit, which will trigger to sent out a sensor report. High byte is the upper limit value. Low byte is the unit (0x01=Celsius, 0x02=Fahrenheit). 1. When unit is Celsius. Upper limit range: -40.0 to 100.0 C (0xFE70 to 0x03E8). E.g. The default upper limit of EU/AU version is 28.0 C (0x0118), when the measurement is more than 28.0C, it will be triggered to send out a temperature sensor report. 2. When unit is Fahrenheit. Upper limit range: -40.0 to 212.0 F (0xFE70 to 0x0848). E.g. The default upper limit of US version is 82.4F (0X0338), when the measurement is more than 82.4F, it will be triggered to send out a temperature sensor report.

Value.label: Set the lower limit value of temperature sensor
Value.Help: When the measurement is less than this lower limit, which will trigger to sent out a sensor report. High byte is the lower limit value. Low byte is the unit (0x01=Celsius, 0x02=Fahrenheit). 1. When unit is Celsius. Lower limit range: -40.0 to 100.0 C (0xFE70 to 0x03E8). E.g. The default lower limit of EU/AU version is 0 C (0x0000), when the measurement is less than 0C, it will be triggered to send out a temperature sensor report. 2. When unit is Fahrenheit. Upper limit range: -40.0 to 212.0 F (0xFE70 to 0x0848). E.g. The default lower limit of US version is 32.0F (0x0140), when the measurement is less than 32.0F, it will be triggered to send out a temperature sensor report.

Value.label: Set the upper limit value of humidity sensor
Value.Help: When the measurement is more than this upper limit, which will trigger to sent out a sensor report. Upper limit range: 0 to 100%. E.g. The default upper limit is 60%, when the measurement is more than 60%, it will be triggered to send out a humidity sensor report.

Value.label: Set the lower limit value of humidity sensor
Value.Help: When the measurement is less than this lower limit, which will trigger to sent out a sensor report. Lower limit range: 0 to 100%. E.g. The default lower limit is 50%, when the measurement is less than 50%, it will be triggered to send out a humidity sensor report.

Value.label: Set the upper limit value of Lighting sensor
Value.Help: When the measurement is more than this upper limit, which will trigger to sent out a sensor report. Upper limit range: 0 to 30000 Lux. E.g. The default upper limit is 1000Lux, when the measurement is more than 1000Lux, it will be triggered to send out a Lighting sensor report.

Value.label: Set the lower limit value of Lighting sensor
Value.Help: When the measurement is less than this lower limit, which will trigger to sent out a sensor report. Lower limit range: 0 to 30000 Lux. E.g. The default lower limit is 100Lux, when the measurement is less than 100Lux, it will be triggered to send out a Lighting sensor report.

Value.label: Set the upper limit value of ultraviolet sensor
Value.Help: When the measurement is more than this upper limit, which will trigger to sent out a sensor report. Upper limit range: 1 to 11. E.g. The default upper limit is 8, when the measurement is more than 8, it will be triggered to send out a ultraviolet sensor report.

Value.label: Set the lower limit value of ultraviolet sensor
Value.Help: When the measurement is less than this upper limit, which will trigger to sent out a sensor report. Lower limit range: 1 to 11. E.g. The default lower limit is 4, when the measurement is less than 8, it will be triggered to send out a ultraviolet sensor report.

Value.label: Set the recover limit value of temperature sensor
Value.Help: Note: 1. When the current measurement lower or equal (Upper limit - Recover limit), the upper limit report is enabled and then it would send out a sensor report when the next measurement is more than the upper limit. After that, the upper limit report would be disabled again until the measurement lower or equal (Upper limit - Recover limit). 2. When the current measurement greater or equal (Lower limit + Recover limit), the lower limit report is enabled and then it would send out a sensor report when the next measurement is less than the lower limit. After that, the lower limit report would be disabled again until the measurement greater or equal (Lower limit + Recover limit). 3. High byte is the recover limit value. Low byte is the unit (0x01=Celsius, 0x02=Fahrenheit). 4. Recover limit range: 1.0 to 25.5 C/ F (0x0101 to 0xFF01 or 0x0102 to 0xFF02). E.g. The default recover limit value is 2.0 C/F (0x1401/0x1402), when the measurement is less than (Upper limit - 2), the upper limit report would be enabled one time or when the measurement is more than (Lower limit + 2), the lower limit report would be enabled one time.

Value.label: Set the recover limit value of humidity sensor
Value.Help: Note: 1. When the current measurement lower or equal (Upper limit - Recover limit), the upper limit report is enabled and then it would send out a sensor report when the next measurement is more than the upper limit. After that the upper limit report would be disabled again until the measurement lower or equal (Upper limit - Recover limit). 2. When the current measurement greater or equal (Lower limit + Recover limit), the lower limit report is enabled and then it would send out a sensor report when the next measurement is less than the lower limit. After that the lower limit report would be disabled again until the measurement greater or equal(Lower limit + Recover limit). 3. Recover limit range: 1 to 50% (0x01 to 0x32). E.g. The default recover limit value is 5%, when the measurement is less than (Upper limit - 5), the upper limit report would be enabled one time or when the measurement is more than (Lower limit + 5), the lower limit report would be enabled one time.

Value.label: Set the recover limit value of Lighting sensor
Value.Help: Note: 1. When the current measurement lower or equal (Upper limit - Recover limit), the upper limit report is enabled and then it would send out a sensor report when the next measurement is more than the upper limit. After that the upper limit report would be disabled again until the measurement lower or equal (Upper limit - Recover limit). 2. When the current measurement greater or equal (Lower limit + Recover limit), the lower limit report is enabled and then it would send out a sensor report when the next measurement is less than the lower limit. After that the lower limit report would be disabled again until the measurement greater or equal (Lower limit + Recover limit). 3. Unit = 10*Recover limit (Lux) 4. Recover limit range: 10 to 2550Lux (0x01 to 0xFF). E.g. The default recover limit value is 100 Lux, when the measurement is less than (Upper limit - 100), the upper limit report would be enabled one time or when the measurement is more than (Lower limit + 100), the lower limit report would be enabled one time.

Value.label: Set the recover limit value of Ultraviolet sensor
Value.Help: Note: 1. When the current measurement lower or equal (Upper limit - Recover limit), the upper limit report is enabled and then it would send out a sensor report when the next measurement is more than the upper limit. After that the upper limit report would be disabled again until the measurement lower or equal (Upper limit - Recover limit). 2. When the current measurement greater or equal (Lower limit + Recover limit), the lower limit report is enabled and then it would send out a sensor report when the next measurement is less than the lower limit. After that the lower limit report would be disabled again until the measurement greater or equal(Lower limit + Recover limit). 3. Recover limit range: 1 to 50% (0x01 to 0x32). E.g. The default recover limit value is 5%, when the measurement is less than (Upper limit - 5), the upper limit report would be enabled one time or when the measurement is more than (Lower limit + 5), the lower limit report would be enabled one time.

Value.label: Get the out-of-limit state of the Sensors
Value.Help: Get the out-of-limit state of the Sensors. Bit mask = 0, within the limit. Bit mask = 1, out of the limit. Bit 0 = temperature. Bit 1 = humidity. Bit 2 = luminance. Bit 3 = ultraviolet. The above bit masks are used to indicate whether the current measurements of the Sensors are out of the lower limit. The below bit masks are used to indicate whether the current measurements of the Sensors are out of the upper limit. Bit 4 = temperature. Bit 5 = humidity. Bit 6 = luminance. Bit 7 = ultraviolet.

Value.Help: Default value: Celsius for EU/AU version, Fahrenheit for US version.
